solution:
From $30^\circ$-$60^\circ$-$90^\circ$ triangle $CEB$, we have $BC=6\sqrt{3}$. Therefore, $FD=AD-AF=6\sqrt{3}-2$. In the $30^\circ$-$60^\circ$-$90^\circ$ triangle $CFD$, $CD=FD\sqrt{3}=18-2\sqrt{3}$. The area of rectangle $ABCD$ is $$(BC)(CD)=\left(6\sqrt{3}\right)\left(18-2\sqrt{3}\right)=
\boxed{108\sqrt{3}-36}.$$
